title: Breaking news in Lincolnshire - BBC News
summary: crash on the a158 partially closes road .
bird flu precautions bring big bills for farmers .
police concerned about psychoactive substance circulating in lincoln .

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me for another week , i hope i and the team have been able to keep you up to date with all things lincolnshire .
we 'll be back on monday from 08:00 but until then i 'll leave you with our five top stories today :
enjoy your weekend .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: blustery rain will spread in from the southwest through the evening before easing away north during the early hours of saturday .
clearer skies and colder conditions will follow , bringing a risk of frost and localised icy patches .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : jet skiing on a nature reserve ?
text: plans to allow jet skiing on a nature reserve in scunthorpe have been condemned by local people .
residents say it will cause damage to the site and drive away rare birds .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: grantham 's watergate car park put forward as potential starter homes development
text: objectors have told the district council to leave a town centre car park alone after it was included in a document proposing areas for development of starter homes .
author: Grantham Journal

documents.title: a1 reopens in both directions
text: the a1 has now re-opened in both directions at harlaxton after being closed for most of the day .
there 's still quite a lot of traffic in the area however so bear that in mind if you 're planning on using the road .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: ten years of spires and steeples
text: you may have attempted this in the past - but the spires and steeples challenge is back for its ten year anniversary .
the route starting in lincoln and finishing in sleaford is an off-road trail which follows marked public footpaths and bridleways crossing open fields and countryside lanes .
it 's in aid of wheelpower which provides sports wheelchairs , training and support to disabled people .
it has such a great community feeling .
we have participants take part from across the country and it 's great to see everyone supporting each other along the way whether they know each other or not .
that 's what makes the challenge what it is .
it 's taking place on sunday 15 october .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays in the south of the county
text: the a1 is still shut in both directions at harlaxton following the incident this morning and diversions are causing traffic build-ups in the south of the county .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: missing newark man found
text: missing luke harris has been found safe and well .
thanks for the rts
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: jail for boston air rifle shooter
text: a boston man who shot five members of the public with an air rifle after binging on vodka has been jailed for 14 months .
39-year-old ruslanas solovjovas of vauxhall road , took pot shots from the upstairs flat of the former wellington pub building on november 13 last year .
armed police rushed to the frieston road area of the town as a result .
when police entered the building they found a clearly drunk solovjovas who told them he was `` jesus christ . ''
passing sentence today at lincoln crown court , judge michael heath told him that he had behaved `` stupidly . ''
fortunately the physical injuries were not serious .
however , you could have caused the loss of eyes and heaven knows what would have happened if you had hit somebody in the temple .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal for missing luke harris
text: lincolnshire police say they 're concerned for the safety of 20-year-old luke harris who was reported missing from the newark area at around 15:00 yesterday .
he was last seen wearing a yellow jumper , green jacket and black jeans and police believe he could be in our county .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: princess anne in louth
text: more now on the princess royal 's visit to louth , she 's been shaking a lot of hands at the lincolnshire wolds riding for the disabled group !
princess anne has spoken to every single volunteer and rider here today in louth
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: the weather this afternoon
text: rather and cloudy and windy across the county this afternoon , with the cloud getting thicker as we head towards the evening .
we could see some scattered outbreaks of rain as well but staying mild .
author: Keeley Donovan
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: pair face trial over term-time absence
text: a couple accused of taking their son out of primary school to attend two family weddings have appeared in court .
the parents , from cleethorpes , each received fines for their son 's eight-day absence from a north east lincolnshire school during term time .
they took him out of school last june to attend the weddings .
at grimsby magistrates court , both denied two charges of their son failing to attend regularly at school .

documents.title: lincoln cancer charity shop footfall down 50 % since city centre works began
text: fundraisers behind a lincoln cancer charity shop say they have seen a 50 % decrease in footfall after the loss of the bus station and works on sincil street .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: weather watchers : lincolnshire 's big skies
text: because a lot of lincolnshire is rather flat it makes the skies seem bigger than almost anywhere else .
we think that this photo taken by wrobz in goltho near wragby shows this off perfectly .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: the headlines
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Carla George
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: bird flu 'threatens farmer 's free-range status '
text: a lincolnshire farmer says he could face a hefty bill because of bird flu precautions .
outbreaks of avian flu in the past few weeks have meant poultry has had to be kept indoors .
neil scaman , an egg farmer , says keeping the birds inside could mean his produce losing its free-range status .
will we have to change the packaging and things like that ?
it could get very expensive but it 's just one of those things and our hands are tied until defra tell us we can let our birds out .
the government says farmers keep the free range status for 12 weeks in special circumstances .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: fatal crash update : a158 re-opens
text: the a158 has now re-opened after the fatal road accident this morning .
a158 is now open !
thank you for your patience !
just to add , what chance has a hgv to stop if a pedestrian with no hi vis on walks out on the hgv at 03:15 at night ?
none .
thanks for tell us .
i was on my way to work on my motorcycle and was wondering why it was closed .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: lincoln sign striker southwell
text: lincoln sign striker southwell

documents.title: five ill after taking illegal drugs
text: five ill after taking illegal drugs

documents.title: couple face court action for taking child out of school to family wedding
text: a couple from cleethorpes are in court for taking their son out of school during term time .
they are appearing before magistrates in grimsby because their 10-year-old son missed 10 days of school to go to a family wedding .
north east lincolnshire council say since a high court ruling last year they 've changed the rules so that if a child 's attendance is above the 90 % threshold they wo n't issue a fine .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: traffic and travel : road closures still in place
text: both the section of the a158 and the section of the a1 remain closed following the incidents this morning .
check the latest here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: coastguard warning as strong winds due
text: the coastguard team is warning us to take extra care today if we decide to venture near our coast today .
gale force winds are expected in many parts of the country .

documents.title: weather watchers : pink tinge in south witham
text: here 's a lovely little photo , taken yesterday evening and sent to us by southwithamerbaz .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : friday 's weather forecast
text: a dry and sunny start .
strong winds .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: princess anne coming to the county
text: the princess royal will be in lincolnshire today .
she 'll first drop into lincolnshire wolds riding for the disabled at louth - where she 's the president - before visiting the sense centre in bourne .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: north lincolnshire 's haxey hood features in book
text: homer sykes has travelled across the country to capture special moments from some uniquely british celebrations - including north lincolnshire 's haxey hood .
the image above features in homer sykes ' republished 1977 book - once a year - from dewi lewis publishing .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: a158 crash : police confirm incident was fatal
text: police have confirmed that the pedestrian involved in a lorry crash this morning on the a158 died at the scene .
they say he was a 23-year-old local man who was walking from the north of lincoln when the incident happened at about 03:15 .

they want to get in touch with any witnesses who may have seen him , described as wearing blue jeans , a dark coloured top and brown shoes , or the blue heavy goods vehicle around the time of the collision .
the stretch of road remains closed .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lego red arrows campaign takes off
text: you might remember when we told you about the campaign to get the red arrows immortalised in those famous plastic bricks .
a design created by former reds engineer , flight lieutenant marcus ramsden is currently on the lego ideas website .
if it gets 10,000 votes then lego will considering putting it on shelves all over the world .
well , in just the space of two weeks more than 6,000 people have backed the design !
marcus says he 's thrilled it 's proved so popular already and explains why he did it :
the whole aim was to inspire the next generation and hopefully the design will let children across the globe learn about the red arrows .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: introducing in lincolnshire rocks the engine shed
text: last night was radio lincolnshire 's very first plugged event .
a special line-up made up of the very best unsigned , under the radar talent in our county and beyond tore the house down at the engine shed in lincoln .
it 's not about x-factor sob stories , or spinning chairs or obnoxious buzzers .
but it is about raw talent and all of the acts we choose have it in spades :
if you could n't make it last night then watch this space because we hope we 'll be able to announce the next plugged line-up soon .
you can listen to some of the music we 've played on our show in the past here .
author: Jono Brine
Presenter

documents.title: 'number of people taken ill ' after bad reactions to legal high
text: police say a number of people had to be taken to hospital yesterday evening because they had a bad reaction to a batch of the drug known as black mamba .
black mamba is a type of synthetic cannabis and used to be a 'legal high ' before they were outlawed last year .
police are warning that this harmful batch is still in circulation but they say those that had to be taken to hospital have since been discharged .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : a1 closure near grantham
text: the a1 is shut south-bound at harlaxton after a crash .
traffic is now building up in the area and is being diverted off at the a607 .
a very serious incident has closed the a1 near grantham .
please avoid the area and follow diversions .
where about exactly ?
from the farrier to downtown in both directions
cheers mate .
sounds a bit of a mess
the queue of traffic travelling north runs back miles and they 're all be coming through town
just what we need today then ayy lol just hope everyone is alright
is that southbound , by harlaxton ?
highways not providing info as yet
both ways from the farrier to downtown
good to know .
reckon @ twitterid gonerby will be heaving with weary ( grumpy ) people this morning
not everyone in gonerby is grumpy , ! !
! accidents happen
yes , they do .
glad to hear spirits are relatively high down there atm
could you provide us with some more detail on this please ?
good old @ twitterid # travellincolnshire
is it still closed we are travelling north towards lincoln and are sat in traffic at the mo ?
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: the headlines this morning
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : serious accident on a158
text: the a158 in nettleham has been closed in both directions between the a15 wragby road east junction and the north lane junction .
there 's been a crash involving a lorry and a pedestrian .
the pedestrian is thought to have been seriously injured .
police say it 'll stay closed until at least 09:00
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning , welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here , ready to bring you all the latest from across the county .
it 's friday and i do n't know about you but i can practically smell the weekend .
want to tell me what 's happening where you are ?
get in touch via email or through facebook and twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

text: tunisia survivor 'tried to save fiancee '

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me for another day , thanks for reading and i hope i 've been able to keep you up-to-date .
we 'll be back from 08:00 tomorrow .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today .
in fact i 've decided to s their advice up a bit with this oh-so-sensual poster :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: the weather forecast this evening
text: any lingering outbreaks of rain through the evening will soon clear eastwards , with clouds breaking .
a mostly dry night is then expected , with clear spells .
however it will stay breezy with a few showers possible , mainly across higher areas .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: calls for runner id tags
text: people who take to the countryside for exercise are being urged to wear id tags in case they become ill .
the danger of hitting the road in isolated locations was highlighted recently for members of caistor running club who fought to save derrick noble who suffered heart problems during a run .
you can watch the full report on look north tonight .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: road closed at bardney this weekend for 'essential gas repairs '
text: motorists are being advised of a road closure at bardney this weekend so engineers can repair a gas pipe .
author: Boston Standard

documents.title: traffic and travel : heavy traffic on a52
text: there 's been an accident on the a52 holland road in spanby around the mareham lane junction .
traffic is building up in both directions .
rtc on the a52 at spanby , slight delays .
it road open .
hi there .
has anyone been hurt ?
how many vehicles/people involved ?
2 vehicles minor injuries
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: lincoln drunk threw glass bottle at train passenger 's face
text: a man who threw a glass bottle in a passenger 's face on board a train in lincoln has been sentenced .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: traffic and travel : congestion in grimsby
text: we 've got some very slow traffic on the a16 peaks parkway in both directions at the a46 weelsby road junction .
avoid it if you can .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: lincoln sign knott from gillingham
text: lincoln sign knott from gillingham

documents.title: golden handshakes for lincolnshire gps ?
text: gps should be given financial incentives to come to lincolnshire , according to one of the county 's councils .
west lindsey district council says it wants the government to attract doctors by bringing in rural weighting - higher wages for people working outside urban areas .
but dr dan lane , from willingham surgery in gainsborough , says it 'll take more than just cash to improve recruitment :
if anything , lincolnshire gps tend to earn better on average than other parts of the country so i 'm not convinced money is the whole story here .
i think it 's a wider issue . ''
author: Hope Bolger
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: scunthorpe steelworks to donate train track
text: british steel in scunthorpe has donated train track to help train students preparing to work on britain 's planned high speed rail network .
the national college for high speed rail will have two sites - one in doncaster and one in birmingham .
thousands of engineering students will be trained to deliver billions of pounds worth of rail contracts , including hs2 .
british steel has donated 41 lengths of 18m rail which will be installed inside the doncaster site before some of it is built around .

peter smith , british steel 's managing director for rail , says : `` the rail will be used for the test track on which the train inside the college will be used , giving the students the chance to work on a real train . ''
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: new signing for lincoln city
text: after theo robinson 's shock announcement that he was signing with southend united , the imps have got some welcome news of an arrival rather than a departure :
we are pleased to announce the signing of gillingham midfielder billy knott on loan until the end of the season .
jesus !
what a signing you 've got .
great player
@ lincolncity fc how the mighty fall
all the best at @ twitterid to @ twitterid do a good job for them .
i know you will .
# sharedhistory
@ twitterid wow # baller will tear that league apart all the best @ twitterid enjoy pal great club & fans
@ that 's a brilliant signing that @ twitterid good luck
good luck to you billy
you have got a very good player in @ twitterid very surprised we let him go on loan !
# gills
@ twitterid good luck , billy .
once a mackem , always a mackem .
unless your name is daryl murphy , adam johnson or jack colback
@ twitterid knott a bad signing
you 've got yourself a cracking signing there fellas .

why we have loaned him to you baffles me but good luck @ twitterid

i expect him to stand out at that level .
great signing for your club .
good luck to you & good luck to @ twitterid
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire Sport

documents.title: listen : 'we 're going to have control of our borders ' - brexit committee in boston
text: as we told you earlier , the brexit committee is visiting boston today to find out what people want from the coming negotiations .
hillary benn is the group 's chairman , and i got an opportunity to talk to him about what he hoped to accomplish in today 's talks .
i started off by voicing what a number of residents have told me in the past : namely why the committee was here instead of getting on with the job :
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: scunthorpe businessman launching new political party
text: scunthorpe businessman des comerford ( says he 's to launch a new political party because too many people are disillusioned with the traditional options .
mr comerford says he 's in talks with the electoral commission and says he 'll launch it properly with a name and official status in four weeks time .
he says the party will work with others to secure the best for people living in north lincolnshire .
we believe we can take several seats during the next local elections .
we 're not going to be naive enough to say we 're going to take x , y or z number of seats .
we do n't know , but we do know we will take seats - that 's guaranteed . ''

documents.title: scunthorpe utd investigate validity of chinese interest in kevin van veen
text: scunthorpe utd investigate validity of chinese interest in kevin van veen

documents.title: lincoln schoolgirl to cut off 10-year rapunzel locks for charity
text: a schoolgirl from lincoln will be cutting off her below-the-knee length hair in aid of the children 's cancer charity , the little princess trust .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest from the bbc lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Carla George
BBC Lincolnshire News

documents.title: this afternoon 's forecast
text: this afternoon will see outbreaks of rain and it 'll be often cloudy , though some brighter periods are likely .
while it 'll be relatively mild , it may not feel it in the wind with a top temperature of about 11c ( 52f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: £ 17m set aside to tackle water leaks in lincolnshire
text: more money is going to be spent plugging leaks in lincolnshire , according to anglian water .
an extra £ 17m investment is being made across the region to tackle the problem , the firm says .
the funding is part of more than £ 400m which will be used to maintain and improve infrastructure in the coming year - as well as giving two water towers in the county a facelift .
emma staples , from anglian water , says the company 's keen to plug any gaps in the system :
leakage is an absolute priority and the money we 're investing will keep it to low levels .
we know that 's one of our customers bugbears , we hate them too and that 's why we 're spending so much . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: boston parakeets : spotted !
text: we knew you would n't let us down .
no sooner had we asked if you 'd spotted any parakeets in the boston area , than pat eyeons from fishtoft sent us this :
pat says this little chappy often appears in her garden .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: humberstone fitties holiday home owners want to run site themselves
text: owners of holiday homes on part of the lincolnshire coast have invited councillors to a meeting later to show them how they could run the site themselves .

last year , it was announced that residents of humberstone fitties would be stopped from staying overnight in their properties from november until march , and now north east lincolnshire council wants someone else to run the site .
papers mistakenly published on the council 's website revealed the chalet owners ' bid to run the site had n't been successful .
north east lincolnshire council has told the bbc the preferred bidder will be named in march , and it believes the bidder will provide the best deal for the council and the people of the county .

documents.title: council 's not-so-romantic valentine 's day advice
text: valentine 's day is fast approaching , in case you had n't noticed .

with that in mind , you may well have started thinking about if you want to go with chocolate or flowers , whether you want to risk it all and ask out that special someone at your office - and most importantly of all , if you want to book a restaurant .
of course north kesteven district council knows exactly what 's at the forefront of your mind when it comes to eating out and has issued an appropriate statement :
are you looking to make a good impression on someone this valentine 's day ?
'look before you book ' , and check the food hygiene rating when planning where to go for your romantic meal . ''
very , er , practical .
they also add that over 98 % of north kesteven 's food businesses are rated a 3/5 or higher when it comes to hygiene , so there are plenty of places to choose from .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: more traffic chaos : lincoln 's yarborough road to partially close for four months
text: a main road in lincoln will be partially closed for almost four months .
numerous roadworks and closures and new one way systems across the city have left drivers feeling more and more frustrated .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: carly lovett : tunisia attack victim was 'perfect child '
text: more now on the inquest into the death of carly lovett , from gainsborough , as part of the wider investigation into the tunisia beach attack in 2015 .
in a statement read out in court today , her parents have described miss lovett , 24 , as `` the perfect child '' .
the court also heard that her fiancee , liam moore , attempted to stop the bleeding and performed cpr but was ultimately unsuccesful .
after he realised that she had died , he lay down next to her and held her hand , the court has heard .
a post-mortem examination revealed that although miss lovett had injuries `` consistent with an explosive device '' she had died from a single gunshot wound to the chest .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: hare coursers fined after crackdown
text: three men have been fined for hare coursing in deeping st james after being caught in a joint-force crackdown last october .

patrick joseph mccann , 23 , billy mccann,18 , both of leicester road , market harborough , and jamie smith , 26 , of chestnut close , rassau , ebbw vale , gwent , had their dogs temporarily seized as a result .
patrick mccann and billy mccann both received fines of £ 120 each while jamie smith received a fine of £ 300 .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'first the shriek , then the long green tail ' : the search is on for boston 's parakeets
text: when it comes to birds , i 'm lucky to see a slightly bedraggled pigeon outside my window .
however , some people in boston say they 've been seeing bright green parakeets .
the rspb think they could be linked to colonies of feral parakeets which have been developing in london for decades - probably following escapes .
the ornithological charity now wants you to get in touch if you 've seen them .
they 've get a really loud ear-splitting shriek so that 'll probably alert you to their presence first of all .
you 'll think , what on earth is that ? , and then look out for big green bird with a long tail .
when they fly they look incredible so they will stand out . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays on a52 after accident
text: the a52 is currently closed in both directions between the mareham lane junction in threekingham and the a152 station street junction in donington .
it 's because of an accident and a shed load .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: big development plans for part of lincoln city centre
text: plans for a new development in lincoln which would see the construction of a hotel , student accommodation , 485,000 sq ft of retail and leisure space and over 1,000 extra car parking spaces are to be considered by city of lincoln council .
the development would be in the st marks area of the city and would include the west side of the current retail park .
this is what developers say it will look like :
even if it does get the go-ahead , it 'll be a while before the becomes a reality .
the developers hope to have it finished by 2024 .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: driver fails to stop after reversing into woman
text: a driver has failed to stop and help a 79-year-old woman after reversing into her in long sutton .
the woman was left with minor injuries after the incident which happened in the co-op car park in west street at about 11:45 yesterday morning .
the driver of the car , or anyone with information about what happened , is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: tunisia inquest to hear evidence about death of gainsborough girl
text: an inquest into the fatal shootings of british tourists in tunisia 18 months ago is today expected to hear evidence about carly lovett , from gainsborough .
she was one of the 30 british nationals to die in the attack when a gunman opened fire in the resort of port el kantaoui .
the 24-year-old was a beauty blogger and photographer and was on holiday with her fiancee , liam moore , who was seriously injured in the attack .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: weather watchers : fire in the skies at hatcliffe
text: now take a look at this shot which was taken at sunset by bbc weather watcher ar in the village of hatcliffe .
it 's spectacular - but practically apocalyptic
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: brexit committee comes to boston
text: a group of mps that make up the brexit committee are on their way to boston , the town which delivered the highest vote share for leave in the eu referendum .
it comes just hours after mps voted to allow the pm to begin the brexit process .
so what exactly are they going to do while they 're here in lincolnshire ?
political correspondent paul rowley has been telling me more - and he says they might even get `` a bit of flak '' from local residents :
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire 's weather this morning
text: cloudy and windy , especially later , with outbreaks of rain , heaviest and most prolonged across more western areas .
it will be a mild day with temperatures above average for the time of year .
author: Jennifer Bartram
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: your headlines this morning
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: traffic and travel : a52 closed in both directions
text: the a52 is currently closed between the mareham lane junction in threekingham and the a152 station street junction in donington .
there 's been a crash and a vehicle has shed its load of offal , so you 're really going to want to avoid that one
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here , ready to bring you all the latest from across the county .
i 'll be keeping you up-to-date with the news , travel , sport and weather throughout the day .
if you want to contact me and tell me what 's happening where you are then you can get in touch here .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: five things we learned today
text: the sun has set on the first day of february , and on our local live updates for the day .
your news , sport and weather updates will continue through the evening .
so lets have a quick look back at five things we did n't know before i clicked publish this morning :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: tonight on look north
text: join peter at 18:30 on bbc one for all the latest news from east yorkshire and lincolnshire .
here are tonight 's headlines from @ twitterid
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: lego red arrows kit vote hits 5,000-mark
text: a bid to create an official lego kit de the lincolnshire-based red arrows aerobatic team has reached 5,000 votes .
the prototype for the lego hawk jet has been created by former reds engineer flt lt marcus ramsden and sqn ldr mike ling , who 's known as red 10 .
another 5,000 votes are needed before the proposal will go to official review .
the red arrows are based at raf scampton and celebrated their 50th season in 2014 .

documents.title: lorry driver arrested on sus of drink driving
text: a 40-year-old-man has been arrested on sus of drink driving after an articulated lorry came off the road near caenby corner (
the a15 has been closed between b1205 and caenby corner whilst the lorry is recovered .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakinglincoln city 's fa cup tie to appear on tv
text: lincoln city 's fa cup tie against premiership side burnley fc will be broadcast on tv .
the impressive run by the imps could put them in the record books if they beat burnley on saturday .
the clash will be on bt sport on saturday 18 feb at 12:30 .
it 's estimated it could raise £ 247,500 for the national league club .
author: Michael Hortin
Sports, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: vulcan bomber re-homed
text: it may be years since it lived in lincolnshire , but the vulcan xh558 is held in great affection here in bomber county .
the aircraft , which was one of three originally designed to carry an atom bomb , was stationed at raf waddington in the 1960s and has regularly appeared in the county 's airshows .
it 's since been moved to robin hood airport , and today has been put in storage until funds are raised for a permanent home .
the moment # vulcan # xh558 was towed into storage at doncaster sheffield airport .
@ twitterid now needs £ 200k for temporary home

documents.title: update : emergency road closure in sleaford
text: more on this emergency road closure in sleaford .
electricity supplier western power distribution say they 've started work replacing underground electricity cabling providing power to 1,600 homes .
west banks has been closed while the 100m section of cable is installed .
our aim is to keep disruption to an absolute minimum , but we apologise for any inconvenience
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: train ticket changes will benefit lincolnshire first
text: sometimes it can feel like a lottery when you 're buying train tickets , the cost of the same journey can vary day to day .
rail passengers in lincolnshire are to be the first to benefit from an overhaul of the ticketing system .
operators want to cut out red tape and jargon which can leave some travellers baffled when it comes to getting the cheapest fares .
trials will start in may on east midlands and virgin east coast routes .
campaigners have welcomed the news , saying the current system is too confusing .
it puts a lot of people off rail travel , and it means lots of people buy a ticket and find out they could have got it cheaper later .

documents.title: have you seen this parrot ?
text: maybe this polly had had enough of crackers
taya the 12-year-old parrot has escaped from her home in nettleham .
owner lianna describes the pet as `` the heart of the house '' .
i 'm gutted , i 've had her over 12 years even just coming out today , i got no `` see you later '' from her
author: Nicola Gilroy
Presenter

documents.title: this evening 's weather : drier conditions
text: here 's the forecast for the rest of the day .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: emergency road closure in sleaford
text: western power distribution ( electricity provider ) has requested an emergency road closure on west banks in sleaford to carry out repairs .
town centre access will be restricted to grantham road , not castle causeway .
it 's not known how long the closure will be in place .
author: BBC Travel
Lincolnshire travel

documents.title: theo robinson departure a `` huge demand on players '' - lincoln city manager
text: lincoln city manager danny cowley has been speaking to us about the effect of the departure of theo robinson .
the imps striker was signed to league-one playoff chasers southend utd late last night .
hear my full chat with manager danny cowley here .
author: Michael Hortin
Sports, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: a quick recap of some of the headlines from our lincoln newsroom today :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln doctor 's cancer breakthrough
text: a new cancer treatment developed by a doctor in lincoln has been described by the government as a potential breakthrough .
professor oleg eremin 's ( therapy boosts the immune system to fight cancer , without the side effects of chemotherapy and radiotherapy .
more than a million pounds has been donated by people locally to help fund his research .
professor eremin says the treatment , which is still in trial stages , could eventually prevent forms of cancer .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: could you be a lincolnshire millionaire ?
text: check the washing machine and your coat pockets .
a winning lottery ticket in north kesteven still has n't been claimed after a fortnight .
the prize is for £ 1 million .
you 're being urged to check the millionaire code printed on the ticket for the 17th of january .
the winning code was vrms 13842 .
could it be yours ?

documents.title: work continues on 'lincoln knights '
text: if you visited lincoln last summer you may have walked along the baron 's trail and encountered various colourful baron statues .
this year , it 's time for the `` knight 's trail '' , which will celebrate the 800th anniversary of the battle of lincoln and the sealing of the charter of the forest .
i 've been down to find out what progress is being made and caught up with artist mel langton , who 's working on one of the `` knights '' right now :
here 's @ twitterid at work # lincolnknights @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
ca n't wait to see these out & about .
concentration face
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: raf apology after 'sonic boom ' reports
text: the raf has admitted that aircraft may have been behind reports of a sonic boom heard in norfolk yesterday afternoon .
listeners called bbc radio norfolk to report homes and windows shaking .
this morning , the raf has confirmed that typhoon jets from raf coningsby were carrying out manoeuvres over norfolk at the time of the reports .
the raf added that aircrews are subject to stringent rules over the use of supersonic speed over land and has apologised for any disturbance .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: grimsby housing development plans rejected
text: plans for a housing development near grimsby have been rejected .
a developer wanted to build 14 new homes in waltham , but some residents say it 's just one of a number of sites which could see more than 400 houses being built .
this morning the north east lincolnshire planning committee rejected the proposal with five votes to one .

documents.title: lincolnshire 's afternoon forecast
text: there 's the chance of some brightness this afternoon with highs of about 10c ( 50f ) .
dry with clear spells for a time tonight , but cloudier later with outbreaks of rain continuing .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: parents warned over children off-road biking in grimsby
text: parents in grimsby are being warned to `` take responsibility '' for their children after several complaints about off-road biking in part of the town .
police say they 're regularly receiving calls about children and young people using weelsby wood as a site for off-road biking with `` no regard '' for other people .
parts of the wood have also been damaged by the bikers , according to humberside police .
sgt will harrison says : `` i 'd urge parents of these young people to ensure their children are using the bikes appropriately and in the right areas .
`` failure to do so could result in the expensive machines being seized , risk huge fines or even a court appearances - but more importantly your loved one being seriously injured . ''

documents.title: $ 250,000 scholarship for lincolnshire lad
text: for most teens , a chance to travel to a foreign country at 17 is something well worth paying for , but one lucky lincolnshire lad is actually being paid for the pleasure .
jack beckitt-marshall has been awarded a quarter-of-a-million-dollar scholarship to attend bowdoin college in maine , usa .
the 17-year-old will head stateside for four years to study a broad liberal arts curriculum .
he hopes to then major in maths or computer science .
this has honestly been the best decision i 've ever made it 's literally a dream come true . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: person dies after being hit by train on east coast main line
text: a person has died after being hit by a train on the east coast main line this morning .
it happened just before 08:30 this morning at arksey lane level crossing in doncaster ( according to british transport police .
the incident has caused cancellations and major delays on the east coast main line and on services from hull to london .
officers attended but a person has sadly died at the scene .
the death is not believed to be sus

documents.title: graham taylor funeral due to be held
text: the funeral of former grimsby town captain and lincoln city and england manager graham taylor is due to take place this lunchtime .
he died earlier this month of a heart attack aged 72 .
growing up in scunthorpe , he began his managerial career at sincil bank where he took lincoln city to the division four title in 1976 .
imps director roger bates will represent lincoln city at the funeral .

documents.title: boston dog pooper scooper evaders to be fined £ 100
text: dog walkers in boston caught without the means to clean up after their pets are to be slapped with a £ 100 fine .
last october , boston borough council approved the public space protection order ( pspo ) , which takes effect on 1 february .

under the rules , the authority can issue fines to those not carrying `` poop bags '' or other removal methods , with penalties for people failing to clean up after their dogs rising from £ 50 to £ 100 .
a public consultation showed 90 % of respondents `` were in favour '' of the measure , the council said .

documents.title: traffic and travel : burst water main sparks road delays
text: macaulay drive in lincoln is currently closed and there 's slow traffic in both directions between the swift gardens junction and the b1182 ruskin avenue junction , because of a burst water main .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : vertigo-inducing crane climb over lincoln
text: this morning i 've been telling you about the hundreds of millions of pounds which have been invested in lincoln in the last two years .
the bbc 's editors here in lincoln thought it would be a great opportunity to scare a reporter and that reporter would be me !
here 's what happened when i climbed up a crane towering over the new one the brayford development in the city centre for a bird 's eye view :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln city 1 - 0 solihull moors
text: fa cup giantkillers lincoln city have extended their lead at the top of the national league to four points with a victory against solihull moors .
meanwhile , imps striker theo robinson ( below ) has joined league one play-off chasers southend united on a two-and-a-half-year deal .
the 28-year-old has scored nine goals for city in the last season , including seven in the fa cup .
author: Su Whitaker
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: lincolnshire legends on lorries
text: if you 've ever been stuck behind a lorry on lincolnshire 's roads , you 'll be pleased to know that some may look slightly prettier from today :
food supplier freshlinc has decorated nine of its lorries with murals representing some of south lincolnshire 's biggest names .
included are naturalist joseph banks , the pilgrim fathers and king john losing his crown jewels in the wash .
the idea behind the murals is part of the transported art project to take art out of galleries and into public spaces .
it 's to get people who do n't normally engage with the arts to be able to experience some great art . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'challenges ahead ' for new police chief
text: lincolnshire 's new chief constable bill skelly starts his job today , after former chief neil rhodes retired yesterday .
the new chief constable ( admits his new job certainly wo n't be easy , particularly with financial pressures on the force .
he was previously a deputy chief constable in devon and cornwall , and worked in police scotland before that .
i really look forward to serving with this very proud force . ''

documents.title: hundreds of millions invested in lincoln - council
text: hundreds of millions of pounds worth of investment has been spent in lincoln in the last two years , according to city of lincoln council .
one of those developments is one the brayford , a new restaurant , office and apartment complex overlooking the brayford wharf in the city ( which cost £ 20m .
others include the £ 100m eastern bypass , the £ 70m cornhill retail park , the £ 150m st marks retail park and others .
developers say the city is becoming an increasingly attractive place to put their money .
lincoln is up and coming .
it 's got a lot of business moving in it 's a happening place . ''
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : rain to start with , then a dry afternoon
text: it 's a cloudy and grey start to the day across the region , with a few mist and fog patches first thing .
here 's owain wyn evans with today 's weather .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays on lincolnshire 's roads
text: things are generally looking good on lincolnshire 's roads at the moment , but a few pinch-points are being reported :

BBC Radio Lincolnshire news

documents.title: good morning : welcome to wednesday 's live coverage
text: good morning on this fine wednesday .
i 'm harry and i 'll be guiding you through lincolnshire 's news and information today .
we 'll have the latest headlines , sport , weather and travel updates throughout the day .
and remember , you can get in touch : drop me an email , or send a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your news , ideas or anything else happening near you .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: southend re-sign lincoln 's robinson
text: southend re-sign lincoln 's robinson

documents.title: goodbye : five things we learned today
text: that 's it from me for tuesday , we 'll be back from 08.00 tomorrow but live updates on breaking news , sport and travel will continue here throughout the night .
just before we go , let 's look back at five things we did n't know before we set out this morning :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: aldi to create 40 jobs as it opens another store in lincolnshire
text: german discount supermarket aldi has confirmed it is due to open a new store in lincolnshire later this year .
the popular supermarket chain , which already has stores in lincoln , sleaford , boston and louth , is on schedule to open a new supermarket in skegness .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: school holiday fines net council more than £ 30,000
text: lincolnshire county council says it 's collected just over £ 30,000 in fines from parents over school absences between september 2015 and september 2016 .
the figures have been releases as the supreme court hears an appeal from isle of wight council which fined jon platt after he took his daughter to florida without her school 's permission .
mr platt challenged the council 's decision in the high court last year , and won .
the department for education says the government 's position remains that children should n't be taken out of school ''without good reason '' .
lincolnshire county council says two families in lincolnshire have been fined for taking their children out of school to go on holiday since september 2016 with £ 1,020 collected in fines .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: will sleepy summariser wake up in time for match ?
text: our commentary team are on the way to solihull for lincoln city 's national league game this evening - but summariser steve thompson 's dropped off to sleep .
hopefully he 'll be awake in time for commentary on bbc radio lincolnshire .
tune in from 19.00 to find out !
thought the car had gone quiet !
# sleepyselfie
lol any news how many we are allowed at burnley
i 'm guessing about 4,000 .
hopefully more though
hope so
part time lincolnshire echo reporter joined in ! !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: coming up on look north this evening
text: here is @ twitterid with the latest headlines from look north .
more on bbc one , 18:30 .

documents.title: your headlines this evening
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : a17 closed
text: the a17 is closed at brant broughton between the stragglethorpe crossroads and leadenham - police say the road will be closed until around 17.30 and you 're being advised to avoid the area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : more drizzle to come
text: tomorrow is looking brighter though .
here 's keeley with the details :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: all grown up - police dogs one year on
text: here 's what they look like now :
but this is how they looked when they first arrived on the county beat :
happy birthday hard to believe they were this little when they arrived with us # pdpupriggs # pdpuplionel

1 year old and destined for a crime fighting future # policefamily

lionel used to visit and chew my office carpet at sherwood lodge !

what a gorgeous duo , happy birthday and good luck to you .
happy 1st birthday boys x
happy birthday boys xx
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: drones drafted in to detect lincolnshire 's water leaks
text: leaky pipes cost water companies millions of pounds every year , and detecting problems quickly , especially when the leaks are underground , is an ongoing struggle .
now for the first time , anglian water - which supplies water across lincolnshire - is to use a drone to find where the leaks are .
the above show the drone being used - including a from the heat sensitive camera on board .
the company says the water shows up on cold mornings when it 's warmer than the ground surface temperature .
the firm says it plans to roll the technology out across the county .
author: Paul Murphy
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: chief constable 's farewell tweet
text: here 's the last message from neil rhodes as lincolnshire 's chief constable .
he 's just retired after 31 years as a police officer .
wonder what he 'll do with his time now ?
i 'm really on my bike now .
just left hq for the last time .
my tweets are now my own .
stand by !
good luck to successor bill skelly
thanks for everything , including support to colleagues in dark times .
crikey you 've never shrunk back on here - more to come !
good luck and best wishes sir .
yes good luck shame you had to be 1st to suffer under hardwick you boys deserve better than commissioners
@ twitterid neil very best wishes and kindest regards paul b
thank you .
enjoy your retirement sir , it 's been a pleasure working for you .
i look forward to your unfettered future tweets !
good luck in your retirement sir , well earned .
enjoy
enjoy retirement sir !
good luck with everything and enjoy your freedom !
good luck in the future neil .
best wishes for the future .
hope you have something lovely planned for your first day `` off ''
@ twitterid thanks for your service
good luck with the next chapter of life .
stand easy sir .
good luck and thanks for all your support .
pleasure working with you neil !
keep in touch for a breakfast at wickenby .
have a great retirement neil you deserve it .
wishing you a long and fruitful retirement neil thank you for your service
~ @ twitterid happy retirement , sir .
you will be a hard act to follow .
good luck neil , enjoy the next adventure
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: stevenage sign scunthorpe midfielder king on permanent deal
text: league two side stevenage have signed scunthorpe midfielder jack king until june 2018 on a free transfer .
king has made 23 appearances for stevenage this season after joining on loan in august , scoring his only goal in a 2-1 win over crawley in september .
the 31-year-old returned to the iron at the end of his loan deal , but failed to break back into the first team .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: gritter watch : no need for action tonight
text: while there 's some talk of a pretty cold february ahead , it seems we do n't need to worry about it just yet at least
temperatures are forecast to be above freezing tonight so no treatment is anticipated .
drive with care .

documents.title: grantham park 's chestnut tree set for the chop
text: a tree which has been standing in a lincolnshire park for over a century will have to be felled because of disease , council officers have ruled .
the tree , in grantham 's wyndham park , is apparently infected with bracket fungus .
south kesteven district council says as it weakens it will become a risk to the public .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man charged over gainsborough assault
text: a man 's been charged in connection with a serious assault on fawcett street in gainsborough on sunday .
the man , who 's 38 , has been charged with gbh and threats with an offensive weapon .
he 's due to appear before lincoln magistrates ' court later .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: here are the top stories from our lincoln newsroom so far today :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: grimsby mp in call for trump parliament ban
text: grimsby 's labour mp melanie onn is one of 73 mps who have called for donald trump to be banned from addressing parliament on a state visit to the uk .

the mps - mostly labour - say any invitation should be withdrawn in protest at the president 's decision to introduce travel bans in the united states on a number of mainly muslim countries , his call for the reintroduction of torture , and his comments on women .
former presidents barack obama , bill clinton and ronald reagan have previously addressed mps and peers in westminster hall during visits to the uk .

documents.title: sheridan smith speaks about new shannon matthews drama
text: award-winning actress sheridan smith , from epworth in north lincolnshire , says she 's struck up a friendship with one of the women who led the search for abducted schoolgirl shannon matthews .
shannon disappeared from her home in dewsbury moor , west yorkshire , for more than three weeks in february 2008 .
her mother , karen , was later jailed for eight years for her part in the abduction .
julie bushby stood side-by-side with matthews before police discovered shannon 's kidnapping .
sheridan smith plays ms bushby in a new bbc drama about the case which starts next week , and the actress says she now counts her among her friends .

documents.title: weather : cloudy and cold
text: here 's the forecast you 'll need if you 're heading out this afternoon :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: new dispersal order to tackle hare coursing
text: senior police have issued officers with special powers again today to tackle hare coursing in the south of lincolnshire .
the dispersal order means police can force groups of people to move on without having to give a reason .
the tweet below , from insp colin haigh , who 's in charge of policing in that area , shows it will be in place until teatime today :
a similar order was imposed before christmas .
farmers have told the bbc that hare coursing is `` out of control '' in some parts of the county .
i have authorised a dispersal order 1030-1730 today in relation to hare coursing .
covers boston and south holland
is it particularly bad today
we have had a few incidents reported but i am keen to let hare coursers know that they are not welcome
i see , good work
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wasting police time charge for alleged armed robbery caller
text: a man from grimsby has been charged with wasting police time after allegedly making a false report of armed robbery .
police were called to elton road in allenton , derby , yesterday to reports a delivery driver had been threatened with a gun and had his wallet , phone and jewellery stolen .
the arrested man , who 's 44 , is due before derby magistrates in march .
author: Sally Swinfen
BBC Radio Derby newsreader

documents.title: man arrested after climbing on train roof
text: we 've heard more now about the incident on the railway in lincoln last night which caused major delays to rail services .
trains were halted after a man was spotted on a train roof just outside lincoln central railway station , according to british transport police ( btp ) .
a btp spokesman said : `` we were called to reports of a man on top of a train near to west holmes signalling box in lincoln just before 20:00 last night .
`` all trains on the line in that area were put on stop to ensure the safe welfare of the man .
`` the man , who is 38 years old and from gainsborough , was subsequently arrested for obstruction and being intoxicated on the railway .
`` he has been held in police custody overnight and will be interviewed by officers today . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: in starlings in stunning display
text: thanks to local photographer john bennett for sending in this beautiful of starlings in a gathering known by ornithologists as a murmuration .
it was taken at whisby nature reserve near lincoln last night .

documents.title: recycling firm in fire exercise
text: lincolnshire 's emergency services are due to test their response to a major fire in a training exercise today .
it 's happening at mid uk recycling 's site in caythorpe , between lincoln and grantham .
it follows a number of incidents at recycling centres - including a major fire in mid uk 's nearby ancaster plant in 2015 .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: handover day at top of lincolnshire force
text: it 's lincolnshire chief constable 's last day in office today .
neil rhodes ( above , left ) is due to retire after more than 30 years as a police officer .
bill skelly , the former deputy chief constable of devon and cornwall police ( above , right ) will take over at lincolnshire police hq tomorrow .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: imps director hopeful on fa cup television deal
text: lincoln city director kevin cook says he 'd be disappointed if their next fa cup match is n't shown on tv .
the imps have been drawn away to premier league side burnley in the 5th round .
mr cook says the publicity has been great for the city .
a decision should be made on which games will be televised by this thursday .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: yorkshire and the humber ukip mep 's damages payout to be revealed
text: the yorkshire and humber mep jane collins ( is due to find out today how much she must pay in damages for libelling three south yorkshire mps .
the ukip politician falsely claimed that sir kevin barron , john healey and sarah champion knew about child abuse in rotherham but did nothing about it .
a high court judge is expected to rule that she must pay hundreds of thousands of pounds .

documents.title: lincoln rail delays caused by 'trespasser '
text: if your train into or out of lincoln was delayed last night - here 's the reason why .
a trespasser meant at least four services between 19.30 and 20.05 were delayed , according to east midlands trains .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays on the roads
text: several traffic hotspots are currently being reported in parts of lincolnshire :
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: bills to rise to pay for county police
text: the police 's share of council tax for lincolnshire is to increase in april , it 's been announced .
it 's going up by nearly 2 % - meaning the average household in lincolnshire will pay an extra 5p a week .
the police and crime commissioner , marc jones ( says the county is not being given a fair share of government funding .
he says he is going to have more meetings with government representatives over the issue , but adds the increase will maintain the current number of frontline officers on the beat in the county .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : cloudy with outbreaks of rain
text: here 's bbc look north 's abbie with the details you 'll need for today :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the top stories from our lincoln newsroom so far this morning :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: good morning : welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , it 's martin with you today .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
if you want to get in touch , feel free to send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .

BBC Local Live, Lincoln

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me today but breaking news and travel information will continue on this page overnight .
we 'll be back from tomorrow with all the latest from across the county and reaction to that all important fa cup draw .
until then i 'll leave you with five things we 've learned today :
have a good evening .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: the weather this evening
text: dull and misty with fog in places , mainly over hills .
cloud thickening from the west will bring outbreaks of rain and drizzle overnight .
far eastern areas may stay drier with clear spells and perhaps an isolated frost .
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: coming up on look north tonight
text: here 's peter with a look at this evening 's news headlines .
great panto by the way at the brid spa last thursday , had a great evening
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: louth church group 'stopped in their tracks ' by amount donated for refugees
text: a church group in lincolnshire say they 've been overwhelmed by the generosity of people donating clothing and blankets to help those in need .
louth churches for refugees were collecting donations over the weekend to help syrian and iraqi refugees who are struggling in the current cold weather and look at how much they got :
suzy davey from the group says it surpassed their expectations :
we thought we might be able to fill a transit van and we were absolutely astonished when we turned up to the church to see a mountain of items .
the influx of people 's donations was so touching , it stopped us in our tracks to be honest .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: woman charged after south lincolnshire shooting pleads guilty to gbh
text: a 57-year-old woman charged following a shooting incident in the south of the county today admitted inflicting grievous bodily harm .
mary jane taylor of little london in long sutton was accused of shooting alan taylor at whaplode on the 8th of december last year .
she told the court she was guilty of causing grievous bodily harm but denied she was trying to kill him .
prosecutors have accepted the plea to the lesser offence .
judge michael heath has requested a psychiatric report before sentencing taylor .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man 'beaten to a pulp ' with his own rolling pin in ugly brawl outside mablethorpe pub
text: a man who armed himself a rolling pin ready for a fight was beaten to a pulp '' with own weapon , lincoln crown court was told .
author: Lincolnshire Reporter

documents.title: traffic and travel : another issue in grimsby
text: we told you earlier about the significant delays on the a46 weelsby road and now another problem has emerged in the area .
one lane is closed on the a180 eastbound at the a1136 .
it 's because of a crash .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: lincoln cyclist describes how air ambulance saved his life after horror crash
text: a cyclist from lincoln has described how his life was saved by the lincolnshire and nottinghamshire air ambulance after he was left with severe head injuries following a terrifying crash with a car .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: traffic and travel : delays in grimsby
text: slow traffic 's currently being reported on the a46 weelsby road in both directions in grimsby at the a16 peaks parkway junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: full steam ahead to bring 114-year-old engine back to skegness
text: you may remember that a few months ago we told you that the lincolnshire light railway had got a grant from the heritage lottery fund to restore jurassic , a steam engine built in 1903 .
progress is well under way and her boiler , firebox and smokebox have all been overhauled and put back in her frames , as you can see here :
lincolnshire light railway spokesman john chappell explains there 's a lot of work still ahead for the volunteers to re-assemble the loco and to ready her for public services this year :
in addition , volunteers are upgrading the track , renewing ballast and sleepers .

these are substantial tasks for a group of a dozen or so people and we 're hoping that more will join what is an enjoyable and fascinating project to keep alive a unique part of lincolnshire 's heritage . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: new owner outlines future of lincolnshire 's local papers
text: lincolnshire 's newly-relaunched newspapers will see more reporters and more engaging stories , according to the new owners of the stamford mercury , spalding guardian and grantham journal , who have bought the titles from johnston press .
iliffe media 's group editor paul richardson says there 's still a need for local papers despite new technology :
if you look back through history , television did n't destroy radio and i do n't think the internet will kill local newspapers .
newspapers may have to change their format a bit , they may have to do things differently but , in essence , words on a page are still very important to people . ''
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: group 's double attack on grimsby taxi
text: a taxi was attacked and damaged twice by a group of about 10 people in grimsby at the weekend .
the vehicle , a white renault trafic taxi , being driven by a 45-year-old woman , was approached by the group on doughty road at about 20:00 on friday and one rear passenger side window was smashed .
about 15 minutes later , the taxi was again attacked by the same group on a different street and the front passenger side window of the vehicle was smashed .
anyone with information about the incident is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: 'five-second drive took 70 minutes ' : motorists caught in 'horrendous ' delays after crash
text: staff working close to the scene of a four-car crash on the a57 have spoken of the `` horrendous '' delays .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: new signing for lincoln city
text: lincoln city have just announced a new addition to the side .
burnley fc winger josh ginnelly is on loan to the imps until the end of the season .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather watchers : burghley at its best
text: it 's a bit grey and miserable this morning across the county , but it was quite a pleasant weekend .
take a look at this snap of burghley house from bbc weather watcher deepings74 :
excellent framing !
it looks a bit like the title card of an period tv drama , do n't you think ?
in fact :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: busiest ever year for lincs and notts air ambulance
text: the lincolnshire and nottingham air ambulance has recorded its busiest year to date .
the crew responded to more than 1,000 life-threatening calls in 2016 - that 's 95 more than the previous year .
incidents included road collisions , horse riding accidents , cardiac arrests and industrial incidents .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: the headlines this lunchtime
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: imps v brighton : why was n't it on telly ?
text: it seemed a bit odd that lincoln city 's victory over brighton and hove albion at the weekend was n't televised on saturday given their upset against ipswich the previous week .
but match of the day presenter gary lineker says that decision was n't up to the beeb :
that is correct .
after lincoln won their replay we asked fa to change to lincoln brighton game .
they refused .
@ twitterid manure fc on tv again ? ?
dull , dull , dull and predictable .
# killingfootball .
lincoln game much better entertainment .
read my timeline
it 's the fa and the constant focus on money i 'm annoyed at not beeb .

are biggest propagandists for man utd as it is , without help from the fa .
how are they ?
how many spin-off series last year ?
but they were very well produced , worth the licence fee !

author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: skegness grand central fire being treated as arson
text: a fire which broke out in the derelict grand central building on skegness seafront last week was started deliberately , police say .
the building had been earmarked for demolition when four fire crews responded to a call in the early hours of last friday morning .
grand parade was closed for most of the day and residents were urged to keep their windows shut while lincolnshire fire and rescue brought the blaze under control .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: over 8,000 from lincolnshire sign 'stop trump ' petition
text: a petition to stop president donald trump 's planned uk state visit is dominating the national headlines today .
signatures have been rising steadily since a us clampdown on immigration came into effect over the weekend and it recently broke the one million-signature barrier :
at the time of writing over 8,000 of those signatures come from lincolnshire and north lincolnshire .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: lincoln v brighton : imps 'inspired by fa cup journey '
text: for the first time in more than 100 years , the imps have made it through to the last 16 of the fa cup .
we 'll know who they face next after the draw from 19:00 tonight , but imps manager danny cowley says it 's incredible to make it this far :
we 've been inspired by this fa cup journey .
it 's connected us with the people of lincoln .
we feel like we 're back in the front of people 's minds and probably their hearts . ''
danny cowley is certainly in the heart of reporter rob makepeace .
look at that loving , puppy-dog gaze :
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : a57 remains closed in saxilby
text: just a reminder that there are still problems on the a57 gainsborough road in saxilby .
the road remains closed in both directions between the b1190 tom otter 's lane junction and drinsey nook due to an earlier accident .
it might be best to avoid the area if you can .
police clearing a57 nr doddington after 4 vehicle crash
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: man suffers head injuries in gainsborough street attack
text: a 56-year-old man has suffered head injuries after being assaulted in gainsborough .
it happened on fawcett street at about 07:00 yesterday morning .
he was taken to lincoln county hospital .
a 38-year-old man has been arrested in connection with the incident .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: humber 's iconic 'dead bod ' graffiti to get new home in hull
text: it 's the piece of graffiti on the banks of the humber which became a legendary marking point to guide trawlers home - and now it 's getting a new home at the humber street art gallery .
the `` dead bod '' graffiti was painted onto corrugated iron on a shed at alexandra dock in the 1960s by skipper len `` pongo '' rood .
dead bod has been in storage since a campaign to save it when the shed was pulled down to make way for the siemens greenport development almost two years ago .
author: David Burns
Presenter, BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: 'too many inmates were crammed into lincoln prison '
text: lincoln prison had 49 % cent more prisoners than it could safely accommodate last year , according to new figures .
author: Lincolnshire Echo

documents.title: phone troubles for lincoln council
text: it appears that city of lincoln council has a problem with its phone lines at the moment , so if you ca n't get through then it 's not because something is wrong at your end .
they say they 're working on fixing the issue but in the meantime a lot of their services are available online :
our phone lines are down this morning - apologies for any inconvenience .
you may be able to find what you need at
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: listen : re-live lincoln city 's fa cup magic
text: the celebrations are still going on this morning after lincoln city beat brighton and hove albion 3-1 at the weekend and are through to the fifth round of the fa cup .
if , like us , you still ca n't quite believe that sentence , then hearing is believing :
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : lincolnshire 's weather with abbie
text: look north 's abbie has had her eyes on the skies for us .
here 's her full forecast for lincolnshire today :

documents.title: traffic and travel : crash on a57 gainsborough road
text: the a57 is blocked at the junction of the b1190 between drindsey nook and doddington .
police say two vans and two cars are involved .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: joint investigation into fatal house fire
text: lincolnshire fire and rescue and the police are conducting a joint investigation after a man 's body was found in a burning house in lincoln .
two other occupants of the property on derwent street managed to escape the blaze , which broke out in the early hours of saturday morning .
police have not yet released the name of the man who died .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: the latest from the lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : congestion in grimsby and near newark
text: it 's a bit busy in places this morning .
over in grimsby there 's heavy traffic on the a16 peaks parkway northbound at the a46 weelsby road junction .
the a46 southbound at the newark showground is just as bad so expect some delays if you 're passing through .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live coverage
text: hello from lincoln , alex here , ready to bring you all the latest from across the county .
we 'll be keeping you up-to-date with the news , travel , weather and reaction to lincoln city 's historic win at the weekend .
if you want to get in touch and have your say then you can reach me by email or through facebook and twitter .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Lincolnshire Live
